Class Deck

java.lang.Object
  Deck

public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object

The Deck class represents a shuffled deck of cards. It provides several operations including initialize, shuffle, deal, and check if empty. This version is based on the Elevens lab, modified for the Blackjack card game.

Version:
20161202
Author:
Richard Schenke

Constructor Summary
Deck()
          Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a standard 52 card deck with 13 ranks and 4 suits, calling the Card constructor 52 times.
Deck(int numDecks)
          Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a deck that contains multiple copies of a standard 52 card deck with 13 ranks and 4 suits.
Deck(int numRanks, int numSuits)
          Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a single card deck with numRanks ranks and numSuits suits.
Deck(int numRanks, int numSuits, int numDecks)
          Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a deck that contains multiple copies of a deck with numRanks ranks and numSuits suits.
 
Method Summary
 Card deal()
          Deals a card from this deck.If the deck is empty (all cards have previously been dealt) the deck is shuffled and size is reset.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Determines if this deck is empty (no undealt cards).
 void shuffle()
          Randomly permute the given collection of cards and reset the size to represent the entire deck.
 int size()
          Accesses the number of undealt cards in this deck.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Generates and returns a string representation of this deck.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Deck

public Deck()
Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a standard 52 card deck with 13 ranks and 4 suits, calling the Card constructor 52 times. The Card constructor has the String arrays of ranks and suits and the int array of point values.
The default (no-parameter) constructor creates a single deck

Deck

public Deck(int numDecks)
Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a deck that contains multiple copies of a standard 52 card deck with 13 ranks and 4 suits. The Card constructor has the String arrays of ranks and suits and the int array of point values.

Parameters:
numDecks - is the number of standard 52-card decks.

Deck

public Deck(int numRanks,
            int numSuits)
Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a single card deck with numRanks ranks and numSuits suits. The Card constructor has the String arrays of ranks and suits and the int array of point values. These parameters must match the size of the arrays in Card class.

Parameters:
numRanks - is the number of ranks.
numSuits - is the number of suits.

Deck

public Deck(int numRanks,
            int numSuits,
            int numDecks)
Creates a new Deck instance.
It creates a deck that contains multiple copies of a deck with numRanks ranks and numSuits suits. The Card constructor has the String arrays of ranks and suits and the int array of point values. These parameters must match the size of the arrays in Card class.

Parameters:
numRanks - is the number of ranks.
numSuits - is the number of suits.
numDecks - is the number of multiple copies of the basic deck.
Method Detail

deal

public Card deal()
Deals a card from this deck.If the deck is empty (all cards have previously been dealt) the deck is shuffled and size is reset.

Returns:
the card just dealt.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Determines if this deck is empty (no undealt cards).

Returns:
true if this deck is empty, false otherwise.

shuffle

public void shuffle()
Randomly permute the given collection of cards and reset the size to represent the entire deck.

size

public int size()
Accesses the number of undealt cards in this deck.

Returns:
the number of undealt cards in this deck.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Generates and returns a string representation of this deck.
